data.enText: a quiet period between times of activity

data.chText: 谈话 / 战斗中的沉寂

data.enText: Just before an attack everything would go quiet but we knew it was just the lull before the storm (= before a time of noise or trouble) .
data.chText: 就在攻击开始前一切都变得沉寂，我们知道这只是风暴前的平静。

data.enText: to make sb relaxed and calm
The vibration of the engine lulled the children to sleep .
data.chText: 发动机的颤动使得孩子们睡着了。

data.enText: to make sth, or to become, less strong
His father's arrival lulled the boy's anxiety.
data.chText: 男孩在他父亲来了后便不那么焦躁不安了。

data.enText: to make sb feel confident and relaxed, especially so that they do not expect it when sb does sth bad or dishonest
His friendly manner lulled her into a false sense of security (= made her feel safe with him when she should not have) .
data.chText: 他友好的举止使她产生了一种虚假的安全感。

data.enText: to make sb feel confident and relaxed, especially so that they do not expect it when sb does sth bad or dishonest
His friendly manner lulled her into a false sense of security (= made her feel safe with him when she should not have) .
data.chText: 他友好的举止使她产生了一种虚假的安全感。

example: there was a lull in the storm

tr: a pause during which things are calm or activities are diminished
example: there was never a letup in the noise
the fighting lulled for a moment
Don't let yourself be lulled into a false state of security
quiet the dragons of worry and fear

example.ex: There was a lull in political violence after the election of the current president.
example.tran: 现任总统当选之后，政治暴力进入了一段暂时的平静期。

value.def: A lull is a period of quiet or calm in a longer period of activity or excitement.

example.ex: It is easy to be lulled into a false sense of security...
example.tran: 很容易就会被麻痹，进而产生一种虚假的安全感。

example.ex: I had been lulled into thinking the publicity would be a trivial matter...
example.tran: 我错误地相信了媒体的报道只是小事一桩。

example.ex: Lulled by almost uninterrupted economic growth, too many European firms assumed that this would last for ever.
example.tran: 近乎持续的经济增长使许多欧洲公司误以为会好景长在。

value.def: If you are lulled into feeling safe, someone or something causes you to feel safe at a time when you are not safe.

example.ex: With the shutters half-closed and the calm airy height of the room to lull me, I soon fell into a doze...
example.tran: 半掩的百叶窗和宁静、通风的高大房间催我入睡，我很快便打起盹来。

example.ex: The swish of the tyres lulled him into a light doze...
example.tran: 车轮呼呼地转着，他不一会儿便打起瞌睡来。

example.ex: Before he knew it, the heat and hum of the forest had lulled him to sleep.
example.tran: 森林里的热气和嗡嗡的声音让他不知不觉便睡着了。

value.def: If someone or something lulls you, they cause you to feel calm or sleepy.
If you describe a situation as the lull before the storm, you mean that although it is calm now, there is going to be trouble in the future.
